ccg-setinfo.name: Nine Rings for Mortal Men doomed to die

card.name: Beijabar Bees
card.text: Vermin, Animals. 20 strikes. Playable only if Doors of Night is not in play. Detainment. May be played keyed to Anduin Vales, Beorn’s House, Rhosgobel and The Carrock. Cannot be played on a company containg a character with one of these sites as a home site. May also be played as a resource short-event by such character before initiating CvCC: opponent’s company faces an attack by Beijabar Bees.

card.name: Between Two Worlds
card.text: Unique. Stature card. Playable on a Ring for MortalMen if borne by a Man or Dúnadan with a normal mind of 8 or more. Bearer may tap test any gold ring item in his company. All non-Maia, non-Nazgûl, non-Undead strikes against the bearer are ineffectual. Bearer may not have followers. Bearer must make a CC to move. Bearer may not bear non-ring items.

card.name: Bolvag
card.text: Unique. Sauron specific. Playable at Minas Durlith. May use shadow-magic, spirit-magic and sorcery. He may play factions at Barad-dûr and Minas Durlith as if he were a leader and with +5 to the influence attempt. You may eliminate an Orc in his company to untap these sites. Discard Bolvag if his company moves to a site not in Udûn, Gorgoroth, Imlad Morgul or Nurn, or to an Under-deeps site with a surface site not in these regions.

card.name: Bound up with It
card.text: Unique. All players must now test any gold ring items they have in play; only ring special items with a printed mp of 3 or more may be played resulting this test. Additionally, any Narya, Nenya or Vilya played this turn may be shuffled into the play deck instead of discarded. Any discarded Ring for Mortal Men may be shuffled into the play deck. This card may also be played as a hazard.

card.name: Cursed Journey
card.text: Playable on a non-black player’s company. The hazard player may choose another site path for the company; the region of origin and of arrival must remain the same, but for each ring item in the company the site path may contain 1 extra region. The new site path must contain a Shadow-land [s] or a Dark-domain [kd].

card.name: Death Carrying Vermin
card.text: Disease. Playable on a character after a successful strike from a Vermin attack, if Doors of Night is in play. Target character must make a body check; failing this check only wounds the character. If not wounded after the check, discard this card. Target character must make a body check modified by -3 at the beginning of each of his untap phases. Any effect that would normally heal the character removes this card instead. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Doomed to Die
card.text: As a permanent event, any character bearing a Ring for Mortal Men targeted by a stature card has his mind reduced by 3. Any character whose mind is reduced to 0 or less due to the effects of this card is eliminated; a Sauron player receives his mp as character mp. As a short event, playable on a Dúnadan or Man character with a body less than 9: character must make a CC modified by -2.

card.name: Drawn to Its Master
card.text: Playable on the bearer of a ring special item. He must make a CC, modified by subtracting the mp the ring gives him. Failing this CCC the hazard player may replace the character’s new or current site with a site in an adjacent region as close as possible to Gorgoroth (ignore any other effects). If the bearer of The One Ring moves to Dol Guldur or Barad-dûr in this manner the game ends: a black player wins the game as though he had recovered The One Ring, otherwise it is a tie.

card.name: Erû's Gift
card.text: Whenever a Man or Dúnadan character is eliminated by any effect other than a CC, each character of the same alignmentat the site may either untap or discard all hazard permanent events played on him (or on the company); any character doing so makes a CC. Discard when any play deck is exhausted.

card.name: Fake
card.text: Playable on a gold ring item. The ring is now tested; opponent may apply a modifier of +2 or -2 to the roll (before the roll). If a non-unique ring is playable as result of the test, it may be played from hand or discard pile. If a ring special item is played, the bearer must then make a CC.

card.name: Fell Deeds
card.text: Unique. Stature card. Playable on a Ring for Mortal Men,if borne by a Ringwraith or a Man or Dúnadan warrior. Bearer’s company becomes overt and may initiate CvCC against any other company (you receive kill mp from it). The body of all strikes against characters in the company is reduced by -1. Additionally, any item in the company has its maximum bonus to prowess and/or body increased to 10 (if lower than 10).

card.name: Hands of a Healer
card.text: Unique. Stature card. Playable on a Ring for Mortal Men, if borne by a Dúnadan or by a non-warrior Man. The body of all characters in the bearer’s company is increased by 1 (to a maximum of 9). The bearer may tap and make a CC to heal a character in his company.

card.name: Hidden Precious
card.text: Playable only during the organization phase.Any ring item borne by a character at a Haven [H] has its mp and CP reduced by 1 (to a minimum of 1).

card.name: Hives
card.text: Unique. Vermin. Playable at a site in Anduin Vales by a character with Beorn’s House as a home site, if the influence check is greater than 5. tap: : ap: during your end-of-turn phase to bring one Beijabar Bees from your discard pile or sideboard to your play deck and shuffle. This faction only untaps if one of your companies is at Beorn’s House.

card.name: Hunt for the Ring
card.text: For every ring item in a company one Nazgûl or Maia, or one Dúnadan or Man hazard creature with an asterix (*) may be played not counting against the hazard limit. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: It Stinks
card.text: All sites with an Orc automatic-attack gain an additional automatic-attack: Vermin — 7 strikes with 4 prowess (detainment). Any wounded character facing a strike from this attack must make a body check. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: King of Mighty Words
card.text: Unique. Stature card. Playable on a Ring for Mortal Men,if borne by a Man or Dúnadan diplomat. +4 to bearer’s EI. One Man or Dúnadan character may be played at the bearer’s current site during the organization phase, in addition to the one character per turn limit. Such character may be taken from your hand, discard pile or sideboard.

card.name: Leeches
card.text: Vermin. Animals. May be played keyed to any swamp, or on a company using port-on-river movement or having faced Enchanted Stream or River this turn. Detainment. Each character faces one strike. Any character tapped by Leeches must make a roll; if the result is greater than the character’s body +2, he is wounded. If no strike of the attack is successful, Leeches are defeated.

card.name: Lord of Beasts
card.text: Unique. Stature card. Playable on a Ring for Mortal Men,if borne by a Man or Dúnadan with a normal prowess of6 or more. Bearer gains the ranger skill. The region containing his current site is also considered a Wilderness [w] for the purpose of resource play. Any hazards which affect the prowess/body of Animal attacks also affect the bearer. Your animal factions give an additional mp.

card.name: Lord of Gifts
card.text: Sauron specific. Offering attempt. Playable on an opponent’s character when making an influence attempt against him. Place one itemfrom your hand or from the influencer’s company (cannot be a manifestation of The One Ring or an Elven Ring) with target character. The influence attempt is modified by +4 or double the mp the item gives opponent. If the attempt is successful, you take control of target character; place this card with the item which may not be transferred. If the influence attempt fails, target character must make a CC. If he fails this check, he is taken Prisoner at the nearest Dark-hold [D] (your choice); discard any ring or jewel items. Rescue-attack — 1 automatic-attack at the site must be faced again (hazard player’s choice).

card.name: Lord of the World
card.text: Sauron specific. Playable if you have more mp than anyother players for one of the following categories: allies, characters, factions, items or miscellaneous mp cards. Rotate this card 90° (at any time) if you have more mp than any other players for one of the above mentioned categories (other than the category chosen to play this card; rotate only once for each category). If rotated 360° you receive this card’s mp. Discard this card if you do not have more mp than any other players for at least one of the mentioned categories. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Lure of the Rings
card.text: All hero characters bearing a gold ring item mustmake a CC at the beginning of their movement/ hazard phase. This CC is modified by -6 when moving through Gorgoroth or a Dark-Domain [d], or to The Under-Forges. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Master of the Dead
card.text: Unique. Stature card. Playable on a Ring for Mortal Men, if borneby Aragorn II or a Man or Dúnadan sage. Bearer may makea CC to cancel an Undead attack. Additionally, bearer may tap to place 1 Undead creature played on his company with this card; the attack is cancelled and the creature becomes an ally under his control with a body equal to the bearer’s and prowess equal to its normal prowess -7. It now yields ally mp as given on the card. You may opt to have it attack an opponent’s company as a creature before resolving vCC. Remove the creature from play afterwards.

card.name: Morgai-flies
card.text: Vermin. Animals. 20 strikes. Detainment. May also be played keyed to a region containing a magic-using minion character’s current site, if you control the magic user.

card.name: News from Realms Past
card.text: Playable on your Ringwraith at one of his home sites outside Mordor or Mirkwood. Discard your Ringwraith and any allies and followers he controls. Place any other cards he controls with this card “off to the side”; return them to your Ringwraith when he enters play again. Your Ringwraith may now be in a company with non- Ringwraith characters and may play Ring for Mortal Men at Barad-dûr (Dol Guldur if The Necromancer is in play and Dark Spires Rising is not inverted). Any attacks keyed to Dark-domain or [d] Shadow-land [s] attack normal against your Ringwraith’s company.

card.name: One of the Nine
card.text: Playable on a character bearing a Ring for Mortal Men with Lord of Gifts. The character becomes an agent (all agent rules apply). Any resources under his control still affect the agent (as if a character). Turn the agent face down and place him at a site in an adjacent region. Opponent may attempt to influence the agent during the site phase (treat as your character with mind 0). Discard all cards attached to this agent when he leaves active play or when he is successfully influenced by your opponent.

card.name: One Ring to Bring Them All...
card.graphics: One Ring to Bring Them All.jpg
card.text: Unique. All characters in the same territory as the bearer of The One Ring (or territory adjacent for a character bearing a ring) that are allowed to move must attempt to move to the same site as the bearer of The One Ring. If they may not legally move to that site, they must attempt to move to the nearest possible site (defender’s choice).

card.name: One Ring to Find Them...
card.text: Playable on The One Ring. Once per turn a gold ring item in the company may be replaced with any ring special item for which it could normally be tested. Any creature that can be keyed to Dark-hold [D] or Shadow-hold [S] may be played keyed to Ruins & Lairs [R] against the company. Cannot be duplicated. tap: take a gold ring item from the discard pile to your hand.

card.name: One Ring to Rule Them All...
card.graphics: One Ring to Rule Them All.jpg
card.text: Unique. Playable on The One Ring. If the bearer of The One Ring is an avatar your GI is increased by +4. All other characters in the company bearing a ring special item have their mind halved (round down) and their CC modified by an additional -1. This card is worth 1 mp for each such character, and bearer’s CC are modified by -1 for each such character. The is no limit to the bearer’s company size.

card.name: Only Four Has He
card.text: Playable on a strike from an agent attacking a character bearing a ring special item. May be played on-guard and revealed if an agent attacks. If played on My Precious, the strike receives +4 prowess and cannot be cancelled. Discard this card if the strike is not successful. Otherwise, no body check is made, but the agent takes control of a ring special item borne by the defending character (attackers’s choice); Any character defeating a strike from this agent may take control of the ring (no body check is made).

card.name: Released from the Master
card.text: Unique. Playable on your Ringwraith at Dol Guldur, if he bears a Ring for Mortal Men, you have in play at least 4 unique factions and characters worth 7 or more mp. If Dark Spires Rising is in play this card must be played at Barad-dûr instead. Your Ringwraith faces an attack: Fallen-Maia — 1 strike with 24 prowess (cannot be cancelled or redirected; any character wounded by the attack is eliminated).

card.name: Ring for Mortal Men
card.text: White player only. Man Ring. Playable at Dol Guldur on a character bearing a gold ring item. May also be played at anysite after facing a Nazgûl attack or after initiating CvCC involving a Ringwraith. Discard the gold ring. Target character faces an attack which cannot be cancelled, redirected or made ineffectual: Fallen Maia — 1 strike with 20 prowess; if successful target character is eliminated. You may include up to 9 copies of this card in your play deck and sideboard combined. If bearer is a Man or Dúnadan with mind of 6 or more: +3 to his body (to a maximum of 10) and bearer can use spirit-magic as if a Ringwraith. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Ring for Mortal Men
card.text: Man Ring. Playable after CvCC when stealing a Ring for Mortal Men from opponent’s company. This item may also be played from the discard pile or sideboard. May only be transferred to a Ringwraith. Cannot be duplicated on a given character. You may include up to 9 copies of this card in your play deck and sideboard combined. Bearer can use spirit-magic (as if a Ringwraith). This item affects a Ringwraith; he may use starter-movement and move to non-Darkhaven [K] sites. Values in parenthesis apply to a Man, Dúnadan or Ringwraith bearer; +3 to body (to a maximum of 10). tap: if borne by a Ringwraith to search your play deck or discard pile for his corresponding Unleashed card.

card.name: Ring-chained
card.text: Corruption. Playable on a character bearing a ring item. The character receives 2 CP and makes a CC at the end of each of his phases if he does not bear a ring item. During his organization phase, if the character does not bear a ring item, he may tap to attempt to remove this card by making a roll — if the result is greater than 6, discard this card. Cannnot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Rings of Power
card.text: All players may take one ring item from their discard pile to their hand (regardless of other cards in play). Alternatively, play to cancel the effects of Rolled Down to the Sea. Remove this card from the game.

card.name: Secret Precious
card.text: Lost Knowledge. Tap a scout and a sage at a Free-hold [F] or Border-hold [B] to make gold ring items playable at the site until the end of the turn. Opponent may bring one hazard from his sideboard or discard pile to his play deck (reshuffle).

card.name: Seek for the Nine
card.text: Unique. Pallando and Saruman specific. Playable if you have at least 7 P and a Ring for Mortal Men in play. You may bring into play any Man or Dúnadan character regardless of his mind. Your Man and Dúnadan characters and factions are worth full mp. Your Ring for Mortal Men borne by a Man or Dúnadan character are worth twice the bearer’s mp.

card.name: Shadows of the Power
card.text: Heralded lord mode. Playable on your Ringwraith at a Darkhaven, if you discard (for no effect) a ring item he bears (cannot be a mind ring). Your Ringwraith becomes a Warlord. +3 to his EI and -5 to your general influence. Your Ringwraith's company is in Heralded Lord mode and may use starter movement. Additionally, your Ringwraith may be in a company with non-overt characters and Half-orcs. You may bring this card to your hand during the organization phase. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Slaves to the Ring
card.text: Playable on a Man or Dúnadan faction, if you have a character bearing a Ring for Mortal at the site where the faction is in play. Target faction cannot not be influenced or discarded by any means. Discard this card and target faction if you do not control a Ring for Mortal Men.

card.name: Strength to Govern
card.text: Unique. Stature card. Playable on a Ring for Mortal Men, if borne by a Man or Dúnadan. Factions and allies played or brought into play by the bearer do not tap the site. Bearer makes a CC when playing a faction or ally.

card.name: The Lord of the Rings
card.text: Unique. Sauron specific. This card must be played at the start of the game in lieu of a minor item. All your ring tests are modified by +2. All your companies bearing a ring item are considered overt and have their hazard limit increased by 1. You may play Ring for Mortal Men after any ring test result of 8 or 9. You may bring a Ringwraith into play for every stored Ring for Mortal Men at the site where it is stored; a Ringwraith costs 1 point of influence to control and may be taken from your sideboard. If The One Ring is stored at Barad-dûr, you may place all your stored Ring for Mortal Men on your Ringwraith characters. You cannot win the game by bringing The One Ring to Dol Guldur or by All Else Is Conquered. If you control The One Ring and receive mp from Lord of the World, you win the game.

card.name: Unspeakable Beauty
card.text: Unique. Stature card. Playable on a Ring for Mortal Men borne by a female Man or Dúnadan character (or by Adûnaphel the Ringwraith). Bearer may designate one male character in her company which may be controlled costing no EI; you may bring such a character into play regardless of his mind value and he must always be controlled by bearer (regardless of any hazard effects). Additionally, +10 to bearer’s influence attempts against opponent’s male characters. This modification cannot be altered by any other effect.

card.name: Vermin for Dinner
card.text: Playable on an Orc or Troll character bearing a trophy or after facing a Vermin attack. Target character may remove a trophy he bears from the game to untap (or untap himself and another character in the company if the trophy is a Man or Dúnadan creature or character). You may discard this card to allow the company to move an extra region. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Wisdom upon His Brow
card.text: Unique. Stature card. Playable on a Ring for Mortal Men, if borne by a Dúnadan. Bearer may use spells (except Sacrifice of Form) as if he were a Wizard. Additionally, bearer may tap and make a CC to take any one spell (except Sacrifice of Form) from your discard pile or sideboard to your hand.

card.name: You've Put Your Finger in It
card.graphics: Youve Put Your Finger in It.jpg
card.text: Playable on a non-Wizard, non-Ringwraith character bearing a ring. The hazard limit for the character's company is increased by one for every ring item in the company. Cannot be duplicated on a given character. During the organization phase, a ranger in the target character's company may tap to attempt to remove this card. Make a roll, if the result is greater than 7 discard this card.
